document.docAuthor: Toluk, Ayşe, Ayyildiz, Nusret & Subías, Luis S.
document.docTitle: Cosmogneta ozkani Toluk, Ayyildiz & Subías, 2007, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Two new species of oppioid mites from Turkey (Acari: Oribatida)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Two new species of oppioid mites from Turkey (Acari: Oribatida)

subSubSection.paragraph: Measurements . Body length 228–244 ( holotype : 244 ), body width 104–116 ( holotype : 114 ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 7–9.
Cosmogneta ozkani
sp. nov. —7) Dorsal view, 8) Ventral view, 9) Genital plates (scale bar for 7 and 8 = 100 µm, 9 = 40 µm).

FIGURE 10.
Cosmogneta ozkani
sp. nov. —Dorsal view.

subSubSection.paragraph: Notogaster ( Figs. 7 , 10 ). Oval, but straight anteriorly, with one pair of prominent humeral processes. Ten pairs of notogastral setae, thick and unilaterally barbed.

Ventral side ( Figs. 8, 9 ). Epimeral regions 3 and 4 with polygonal network, but on epimere 2 polygonal network is visible only in median part. Epimeral setal formula 3 - 1-3 - 3 . Genital plate 26 in length, 28 in width, with five pairs of setae. Form and position of genital setae as shown in
Fig. 9
. Anal plate 38 in length, 30 in width, with two pairs of setae. Aggenital setae and three pairs of adanal setae short and thin. Distance between genital and anal plates 38 . Lyrifissure iad situated in para-anal position. Adanal setae ad
1 in
postanal, ad
2 in
para-anal and ad
3 in
preanal position.

subSubSection.paragraph: Etymology. This new species is named in honor of Prof. Dr. M. Özkan, Uludag University, Turkey , for his contribution to the knowledge of Turkish mite fauna.

Remarks. Until now, only three species of the genus
Cosmogneta
have been described, namely
C. impedita
Grandjean, 1960
from France ,
C. kargi
Grandjean, 1963
from Germany and
C. cassolai
Bernini, Baratti and Avanzati, 1991
from Italy ( Grandjean 1960 , 1963 ;
Bernini et al. 1991
;
Subias 2004
).

These species, and
C. ozkani
, are all similar to each other but can be identified with the following key.

paragraph.keyLead:
2 . All notogastral setae thick and barbed; length = 228–244
................................................ C. ozkani
sp.nov.

- The setae c
2
and ps series short and thin, the remaining notogastral setae thick, apically enlarged and peni- cillate; length = 270 and 271
................................................. C. cassolai
Bernini, Baratti & Avanzati, 1991

3 . All notogastral setae thin and smooth; length = 300–320
..................................... C. kargi
Grandjean, 1963

- The setae c
2
and ps series short and thin, the remaining notogastral setae thick, apically enlarged and curved spatula-like; length = 270–310
............................................................ C. impedita
Grandjean, 1960
